meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the macrocosm.
meanings.sent1: The macrocosmic view of the universe is awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent2: She gazed at the macrocosmic sky filled with stars.
meanings.sent3: The macrocosmic perspective made the tiny ant seem like a giant explorer.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were as macrocosmic as the vast ocean.
meanings.sent5: The macrocosmic concept of infinity stretched her imagination.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the universe or cosmos, especially as distinct from the earth.
meanings.sent1: The macrocosmic forces of the universe are beyond our comprehension.
meanings.sent2: Studying the macrocosmic phenomena in space is fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The macrocosmic distances between planets made interstellar travel seem daunting.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered to macrocosmic realms beyond the stars.
meanings.sent5: The macrocosmic beauty of the Milky Way left him speechless.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a large or great scale.
meanings.sent1: The macrocosmic proportions of the mountain range were breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The macrocosmic impact of the decision affected the entire company.
meanings.sent3: His macrocosmic appetite led him to order the biggest burger on the menu.
meanings.sent4: The macrocosmic scope of the project required extensive planning.
meanings.sent5: The macrocosmic size of the ancient tree filled the forest with grandeur.
